content.rendered:
Hi folks and welcome to Ossocubo’s devlog! Yay!

You know, we have been thinking for a while about whether or not to open a devlog.
We were all concerned about the actual amount of interesting things to say or the quality of the material to show, but since the development of Blue Volta has become a real thing in the latest weeks, we decided to act bravely enough to open this promising page.

The plan is basically to publish at least a post a week in which me, or the other Ossocubo’s guys, will talk about news concerning the development of our projects and other activities of the team, all without spoilers.

Obviously we will also talk about other topics, as Blue Volta is only our first project… so who knows what the future holds! But there’s no need to rush, so lets enjoy one moment at a time on a peaceful and constant zen flow.

So, please have a seat and make yourself confortable: we hope you’ll enjoy the ride!

Luca

yoast_head_json.author: Luca

@graph.name: Ossocubo
@graph.description: a small game development team from Switzerland and Italy.

jetpack-related-posts.title: So… what’s the plan?
jetpack-related-posts.author: Luca
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Until a couple of months ago, the search for a publisher was not a priority for us. At first, Blue Volta was a project to express our strengths and skills, which we worked on in our spare time. As time has passed, Blue Volta has grown in shape and size,…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Game Over Milano 2016
jetpack-related-posts.author: Luca
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Last weekend we were guests of Game Over Milano, an underground Italian Indie Developers festival. For the occasion we decided to bring a "beefier" version of Blue Volta's demo, and it has been warmly welcomed. We received lots of impressions and suggestions, which will help us improve the game as much…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Habemus composer!
jetpack-related-posts.author: Luca
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We have a composer for Blue Volta. After a long search for someone who would share our vision on Blue Volta, we can finally say that we found the right musician for the project. So we officially welcome aboard Paolo Giacci, talented composer made in Abruzzo. https://www.paologiacci.com https://soundcloud.com/paolo-giacci/sets/spotlight Paolo is…

jetpack-related-posts.title: New artwork!
jetpack-related-posts.author: Francesco Pirini
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: I finally read Hellboy and i really liked the super expressive way Mignola uses black and white . Then i started to draw and came up with this random artwork!

jetpack-related-posts.title: screen printing!
jetpack-related-posts.author: Mattia Pirini
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: we are working on some DIY merchandise, mostly screenprinted tees and posters. Here's some photos!

jetpack-related-posts.title: Blue Volta is dead, long live Blue Volta!
jetpack-related-posts.author: Luca
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We knew that developing a game would not be easy, and that looking for someone to finance a classic point and click graphic adventure in 2017 would have made us sweat a lot. However, something happened that forced us to slow down and re-evaluate the project overall: life. Read more…
